info.lead: Frequency of use of stylistically laden words by the MP.
text: We define excessive, above average and average vocabulary in MPs' speeches by combing the qualifiers {link1} and {link2}.
Upoštevani so le kvalifikatorji, ki so v obeh slovarjih tik za zaglavjem in imajo doseg do konca geselskega sestavka (ne pa tudi kvalifikatorji za posamezne pomene oziroma rabe).
Company {link3} prepared a list of words containing select qualifiers from transcripts of parliamentary speeches.

The connected graph is showing the proportion of each type of vocabulary in the MP's speeches compared to the average and calculated for the whole sitting of the parliament. The proportions are calculated using the following algorithm: we look at all the speeches by the MP and count the number of words (and their recurrences) in each vocabulary category. We run this analysis for all the MPs and then divide the MP's value with the average value (a sum of all the MPs divided by the number of the MPs). Values of categories for each MP are normalised (min 1 - max 100).
elevated-qualifiers: Kvalifikatorji iz SSKJ: evfemistično (evfem.), mitološko (mitol.), pesniško (pesn.), knjižno (knjiž.), zastarelo (zastar.), starinsko (star.)
excessive-qualifiers: Kvalifikatorji iz SSKJ: vulgarno (vulg.), slabšalno (slabš.), ekspresivno (ekspr.), ironično (iron.), otroško (otr.)
simple-qualifiers: Kvalifikatorji iz SSKJ: narečno (nar.), pogovorno (pog.), nižje pogovorno (nižje pog.)
